clinical_study.brief_title: Measurement of Jugular Venous Pulse in Critically Ill Patients.
clinical_study.official_title: An Evaluation of the Utility of Clinical Examination for the Measurement of Jugular Venous Pulse in Critically Ill Patients.

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the utility of clinical bedside examination for the measurement of jugular venous pulse in critically ill patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
Procedures: All patients with central venous catheters (CVP) will undergo physical examination of the jugular veins, while blinded to the actual CVP measured from the catheter. Clinicians with various experience levels (attending physician, fellow, resident physician, 4th year medical student) will participate.
The following clinical data will be obtained: Demographic data such as age, sex, weight and diagnosis will be collected. Each clinician's bedside CVP will be recorded from the bedside monitor. Clinicians will be blinded to bedside monitor.

clinical_study.condition: Jugular Venous Pulse Measurement in Critically Ill Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients admitted to the ICU who have existing central venous catheters.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients admitted to the ICU who do not have existing central venous catheters

results_reference.citation: Vinayak AG, Levitt J, Gehlbach B, Pohlman AS, Hall JB, Kress JP. Usefulness of the external jugular vein examination in detecting abnormal central venous pressure in critically ill patients. Arch Intern Med. 2006 Oct 23;166(19):2132-7.
